Body:
BC-BUDGET-SPI 
   The Seattle Post-Intelligencer plans to move the following for
clients of the NYTimes News Service for editions of Saturday, Sept.
11, and thereafter. If you have any questions, please call Veronica
Villarreal at (206) 448-8342.

   SEATTLE-POLICE (Seattle) _ Seattle police officers failed to
appear in Municipal Court for scheduled trials about a hundred
times over the past two years, causing all the charges to be
dismissed. In many cases, accused drunken drivers and alleged
abusive husbands escaped possible jail time. One man's
blood-alcohol level was measured at 0.32 percent, which the
prosecutor called a ``slam dunk'' conviction.

   By Kimberly A.C. Wilson and Vanessa Ho. (Story will move in the
``a'' category.)

   IMMIGRANTS _ The Canadian destroyer Huron has taken on 150-170
Chinese from a boat seized late Thursday in the largest-ever
human-smuggling operation off the West Coast, Canadian immigration
officials say. This brings the total of would-be migrants to more
than 600 people on four boats. The Huron will tow the boat to
Esquimalt on Vancouver Island Friday night.

   By Joel Connelly. (Story will move in the ``a'' and ``i''
categories.)

   BLIND-SHOPKEEPER-ART (Seattle) _ Dennis Noyes, the 40-year-old
legally blind owner of a snack shop on the ground floor of the King
County Courthouse in Seattle, was cited earlier this year for
selling tobacco to a minor. Noyes says he was unfairly targeted
because of his condition.

   By Kimberly A.C. Wilson. (Story has moved in the ``a''
category.)

   TV-HOPE (Undated) _ As another new entry in Pax TV's slate of
family-themed programming, ``Hope Island'' is undeniably sweet.
Sweetness seems to be the yardstick by which all Pax TV shows are
measured. But, just as a great play can be undone by a bad
performance, ``Hope Island'' runs aground on the shallow acting of
an amateurish cast.

   By John Levesque. (Story has moved in the ``e'' category.)

   BBA-MARINERS (Baltimore) _ Seattle Mariners at Baltimore.

   By Tyler Kepner. (Story will move in the ``s'' category.)

   BBA-MARINERS-NOTEBOOK (Baltimore) _ Notes from Friday's
Mariners-Orioles game.

   By Tyler Kepner. (Story will move in the ``s'' category.)
